metadata.name: The Last of the Behrupia (Impersonator) #1/45
metadata.description:
The Last of the Behrupia (Impersonator) 

A gaudy exposition of visual excesses, employing shock and awe in an entertainment form that pre-dates broadcast.  
Behrupias or Impersonators, are a dying vocation that once drew large crowds through vivid projections of demons, animals and mythical creatures drawn from a deeply personal interpretation of popular fiction.  
This typology of portraits preserves this wonderful and awe-inspiring art-form in all its glory and detail.

BEHRUPIA have never been captured in a portrait setting.
